summary: Small Fortress camp in the hills of Riverwood.
descriptionHtml:
[size=6]FROSTWICK FORTRESS[/size][size=1](Name Pending)

[/size]This is a small fortress located in the mountains just south of Riverwood. It has no interior areas right now but it will if I continue tinkering with this. Forstwick Fortress is a creation mainly made out of boredom but I am kind of taking a liking to it. Here are the features as of right now....

1/22/2015

Fixed a couple small bugs including that annoying falmer cave mesh in the thieves tunnel. Should all look prim and proper now.

1/17/15.2 Most recent but not so massive update (Notice the smaller typeface)
[size=2]I now have a lot more storage in the fort. Added a bunch of misc. barrels, and some labeled containers for food and junk
I also now have an escape tunnel located next to the prison cell.Â [/size]

[size=5]1/17/15.1 Massive Update[/size]
[size=3]I have added an entire interior area to the inside of the fortress. I would describe the inside as being 90 percent done. I say 90 percent, because lets face it, it's got more bugs than a 10 dollar motel. None ofthe displays are working properly, so those are visible but nothing can be added to them. There is also the problem with some of the items I used as "props" to decorate the place, showing their names ingame (ex, Iron sword) making it appear as though you could pick them up, which you cannot. They are basically a static mesh, meaning they cant be moved. Are they really really heavy, or have the gods deemed you not worthy of moving them? I dont know. (Not an actual bug, just a bit of false advertising) I also have a tiny bit more work to do on the ramparts, bu all in all, this baby is completed..... For now.

1/17/15 Not so massive update (Notice the smaller typeface)
I now have a lot more storage in the fort. Added a bunch of misc. barrels, and some labeled containers for food and junk
I also now have an escape tunnel located next to the prison cell. (I know what you're thinking, but whats the worst that could happen?) This when entered will do two things depending on which version you use. It will...

A.Dump you straight outside in skyrim outside the fort and down the hill
or
B.Take you into a cave (No loadscreen, it's the same cell) which leads to a secret thievery room. Has some more storage for the shadier type characters, or maybe it's just a place to get away from that husband or wife.

I would consider both of these beta and I want to hear back from people who use them. I had some strange framerate issues with this version, but it's most likely in my end.

[/size][size=4]Still to do
[/size]Fix those super fly weapon racks and mannequins (<-- Speeled that write on me furst try)
[s]Add more storage. Like way more. As of now I really only have weapons, armor and misc chests.[/s]
Dress the table on the ramparts. Right now it looks pretty nekkid.

[size=5]Details-[/size]

-Multiple tents for you or followers (right now only one has a bed in it)
-Bunks inside for sleeping. (Also gives you so much more room for activities)
-A kitchen and mess hall
-A small prison and a jailers desk
-An officers tent with a reeeally cool writing desk and some storage for your finely polished officers cuff links
-Workbench, grinding wheel, and anvil. You need a place to make and maintain your weapons. This is a fortress after all
-Tanning racks? Hell no, what do you think this is? A holiday inn?
-A great room for chillin
-An armory worth fillin
-A training room for killin


I will continue this if people like it enough, or if I decide I like it enough. Shoot me any requests on what you think I should have in the fort and I could probably make it happen.
author: Skeeter
